Identification.LongTitle: Regulations Relating to the Inspection of Electricity and Gas Meters and Supplies

Provision.Text: Whereas, pursuant to subsection 28(2) of the Electricity and Gas Inspection Act a copy of the proposed Electricity and Gas Inspection Regulations, substantially in the form annexed hereto, was published in the Canada Gazette Part I on August 10, 1985 and a reasonable opportunity was thereby afforded to interested persons to make representations with respect thereto to the Minister of Consumer and Corporate Affairs.

Therefore, Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Consumer and Corporate Affairs, pursuant to section 28 of the Electricity and Gas Inspection Act*, is pleased hereby to make the annexed Regulations relating to the inspection of electricity and gas meters and supplies, effective January 25, 1986.

Section.Text: These Regulations may be cited as the Electricity and Gas Inspection Regulations.

Subsection.Text: In these Regulations,

Definition.Text: absolute pressure scale means the pressure measuring scale the zero of which represents the pressure exerted by a total vacuum; (échelle de pression absolue)

accreditation audit means an assessment of the facilities, procedures and capabilities of an applicant for accreditation as a meter verifier to ascertain whether the required standards of meter performance control can be met and maintained by the applicant; (vérification d’accréditation)
Act means the Electricity and Gas Inspection Act; (Loi)

average flowing gas temperature means the time weighted or the volume weighted average of the temperatures of the gas flowing through a meter during the period a volume of gas is measured by the meter; (température moyenne d’écoulement du gaz)

average meter pressure means the time weighted or the volume weighted average of the pressures exerted by the gas within a meter during the period a volume of gas is measured by the meter; (pression moyenne du compteur)

electricity metering installation means an installation that consists of more than one electricity meter installed at the same location and that is used for the purpose of obtaining the basis of a charge for electricity supplied to a purchaser; (installation de mesure de l’électricité)

gas metering installation means an installation that consists of more than one gas meter installed at the same location and that is used for the purpose of obtaining the basis of a charge for gas supplied to a purchaser; (installation de mesure du gaz)

gauge pressure scale means the pressure measuring scale the zero of which represents the pressure exerted by the earth’s atmosphere at the time and place the measurement is taken; (échelle de pression manométrique)

measured atmospheric pressure means the time weighted or volume weighted average of the atmospheric pressures measured at the location of a meter during the period a volume of gas is measured by the meter; (pression atmosphérique mesurée)
Measurement Canada office means any office of the Department of Industry for use by persons employed in the administration of the Act; (bureau de Mesures Canada)
standard conditions means standard temperature and standard pressure; (conditions normales)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the International system of units, an absolute pressure equal to 101.325 kPa, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the Imperial system of units,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 14.73 psia, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 30 in. of mercury at 32°F; (pression normale)

Definition.Text: standard temperature means a temperature that is equal to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 15°C in the International system of units, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 60°F in the Imperial system of units; (température normale)

Definition.Text: standard volume means a volume of gas expressed in units of either the cubic metre or the cubic foot at standard pressure and standard temperature as determined in accordance with section 35. (volume normal)

Subsection.Text: Where a word or expression is used in these Regulations to describe a type of meter, a function or part of a meter or a measurement, that term shall have the meaning set out in the appropriate specifications, as amended from time to time, made available pursuant to sections 12, 18, 19, 44 and 45.
Instrument transformers that are designed and constructed to have fixed, non-adjustable accuracy characteristics are exempted from subsection 9(1) of the Act.

A gas meter with a broken seal is exempt from the requirement that it not be continued in use until it has been reverified under subsection 15(2) of the Act if all of the following conditions are satisfied:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the seal was deliberately broken by an inspector or accredited meter verifier for the purpose of installing or removing a device that transmits the reading of the meter to a remote location;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: no components of the meter other than the register cover and the register have been removed from the meter;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any component that has been removed from the meter has been promptly replaced such that the reading of the register is unchanged except for, in cases where the register has not been removed, increases indicating the volume of gas that passed through the meter during the time the seal was broken; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the meter is promptly resealed and restamped, relabelled, retagged or otherwise marked by an inspector or accredited meter verifier in accordance with the specifications made available by the director pursuant to section 18 of these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: A meter that was originally sealed using a plastic filament of any diameter or a metallic filament with a diameter of less than 0.644 mm and that is discovered in service with a broken seal is exempt from the requirement of subsection 15(2) of the Act that it not be continued in use until it has been reverified if both of the following conditions are satisfied:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: there is no visible sign that the broken seal resulted from an attempt to alter or affect the working parts or adjustments of the meter or in any other way affect the registration of the meter; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the meter is resealed by an inspector in accordance with the Act and these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The director may delegate, in writing, his functions under any provision of the Act, other than subsection 11(1) or section 22.
Prior to any delegation pursuant to subsection (1) notice of the delegation shall be published in the Canada Gazette.

Where the amount of electricity supplied and the time-related demand for electricity supplied are the joint basis of a charge for electricity sold to a purchaser, the unit of measurement for the sale of such electricity shall be, with respect to the amount of electricity sold, a unit referred to in paragraph 3(1)(a) of the Act and, with respect to the time-related demand for electricity sold,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the watt;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the volt-ampere; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the var.

Subsection.Text: Where the unit of measurement for the sale of electricity is the volt-ampere or volt-ampere hour, vector addition shall be used to determine the total number of such units in a combination of polyphase circuits.
The cubic metre and the cubic foot referred to in subparagraph 3(1)(b)(i) of the Act shall be determined at standard pressure and at standard temperature.

The British Thermal Unit referred to in subparagraph 3(1)(b)(ii) of the Act shall be defined as the quantity of energy that must be added to one pound avoirdupois of distilled water to raise its temperature from 60°F to 61°F under standard pressure and is represented in these Regulations by the symbol “Btu(60.5)”.

Section.Text: A measuring apparatus that is required for measurement of electricity or gas or examination of meters shall be calibrated in the following manner:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: by testing its accuracy at points throughout the measuring range of the apparatus; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: by tracing its accuracy at one or more points tested in accordance with paragraph (a) to reference standards kept by the National Research Council of Canada.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of section 5 of the Act, the calibration of a measuring apparatus referred to in section 7 shall be certified by the director on receipt of written particulars establishing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that the apparatus has been calibrated in the manner prescribed in section 7;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that the proposed manner of installation and use of the measuring apparatus is appropriate; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: that no error at any of the points tested throughout the measuring range referred to in section 7 exceeds two per cent of the value or reading at that point indicated by the reference standard referred to in paragraph 7(b).

Subsection.Text: A certificate issued pursuant to subsection (1) shall be valid

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: only for use of the measuring apparatus within the measuring range referred to in section 7;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: only for the installation and use of the measuring apparatus as referred to in paragraph (1)(b); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a measuring apparatus set out in an item of column I of the table to this section, for the period set out in column II of that item.

Subsection.Text: The register referred to in subsection 6(1) of the Act shall be maintained for the registration of contractors who hold a certificate of registration pursuant to subsection 6(2) of the Act and shall contain for each of the contractors the information referred to in subsection (2).

A contractor who wishes to register under section 6 of the Act shall apply in writing for a certificate of registration and indicate whether the application concerns the supply of electricity or gas and such application shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the contractor;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the principal place of business of the contractor; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the geographical area in which the contractor intends to operate.

Subsection.Text: The original of a certificate of registration shall be sent to the contractor who has applied therefor and a copy thereof shall be retained with the register.

Where there is any change in the information provided by a contractor pursuant to subsection (2), the contractor shall forthwith inform the director in writing of any such change and shall return to the director the certificate of registration to which the change applies.

Section.Text: For the purposes of subsection 6(3) of the Act, a notice referred to in that subsection shall be sent by registered mail, shall state the date on which the contractor ceased to sell electricity or gas on the basis of measurement and shall contain details as to the disposition or intended disposition of all meters owned, used or possessed by the contractor.

Subsection.Text: In this section,

Definition.Text: owner means an owner referred to in subsection 16(1) of the Act; (propriétaire)
owner’s records means the records required to be kept by an owner pursuant to subsection 16(2) of the Act. (dossier)

Subsection.Text: An owner’s records shall contain the following information and documentation if applicable for each verified or reverified meter in that owner’s use, namely,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the type designation, serial number, rating and multiplier assigned by the manufacturer,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the purchaser’s account number, name and address,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the inspection number assigned by the contractor,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the meter’s latest reverification,

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the meter’s initial verification or purchase,

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the applicable period referred to in section 12 of the Act within which the meter shall be submitted to reverification,

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the most recent certificate issued for the meter by an inspector or an accredited meter verifier,

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the parent group identification assigned by the owner,

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the meter’s current installation address,

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the meter’s installation at its present location,

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an in-service unsealed meter, the date and nature of any maintenance work, and the date and results of any calibration,

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the date or dates on which the meter was sold, scrapped or otherwise disposed of, leased or lost, and

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: for each billing period, the metering information used by the owner in establishing a charge,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: and, in the case of a verified or reverified meter used in respect of gas, shall also contain the following information, namely,

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: an indication whether the verified or reverified meter corrects for temperature or pressure, or both,

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: the metric conversion factor used for the purpose of billing,

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: the mean atmospheric pressure or the atmospheric pressure calculated, declared or measured, as the case may be, pursuant to section 36 or 37, and applied to measurement calculations,

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: where the pressure exerted by the gas within the meter is maintained constant by the use of an approved regulating device, the pressure multiplier established for the meter pursuant to section 36, and

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: where the average meter pressure exceeds the mean atmospheric pressure or the atmospheric pressure calculated, declared or measured, as the case may be, pursuant to section 36 or 37, by more than 3.5 kPa in the International system of units or 0.5 psi in the Imperial system of units,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a non-pressure converting meter, the average meter pressure expressed on the gauge pressure scale for each billing period,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a non-temperature converting meter, the average flowing gas temperature for each billing period,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the average relative density, the average carbon dioxide content and the average nitrogen content of gas metered for each billing period,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the supercompressibility factor established pursuant to section 40 and the method of its determination for each billing period, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an orifice meter, the size of the orifice plates and the dimensions of the primary element components in the orifice meter.

Subsection.Text: An owner’s records shall contain, in addition to the information referred to in subsection (2), the following information on a calendar year basis with respect to the verified or reverified meters in use by that owner:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the total number of verified or reverified meters used to measure electricity or gas supplied

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: to residential locations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: to industrial or commercial locations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a listing of the inspection numbers and types of verified or reverified meters due or overdue for reverification.

Subsection.Text: Where an owner installs a gas metering installation or an electricity metering installation, the owner’s records shall contain, in addition to the information referred to in subsection (2) for each meter, the following information respecting the installation of the meters:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: details of any apparatus, wiring and piping that may affect the accuracy of the meters;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the consumption on a calendar year basis of electricity or gas at that location; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an electricity metering installation, the overall multiplier.

Subsection.Text: Where an owner has installed a gas metering installation or an electricity metering installation, that owner shall provide forthwith to the director the information contained in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the records respecting the installed meters as referred to in

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: paragraphs (2)(a) to (d),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: paragraphs (2)(p) and (q), and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: subparagraph (2)(r)(v); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the records respecting the installation as referred to in paragraphs (4)(a) and (c).

Subsection.Text: Where an owner sells gas on the basis of energy units, the owner’s records shall contain the following information respecting the owner’s gas distribution system:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: details of the system, including the location of each point of supply of gas thereto;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the method whereby the calorific power of the gas sold is determined; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the calorific power of the gas sold and the variation thereof.

Subsection.Text: An owner’s records shall contain the following information respecting the determination of a supercompressibility factor:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: details of the system, including the location of each point of supply of gas; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the method by which the supercompressibility factor of the gas sold is determined.

Subsection.Text: An owner shall retain the records containing the information referred to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in subsection (2) for a period of at least 12 months after the date the meter ceased to be used;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in subsection (3) for a period of at least 12 months after the expiration of the calendar year to which the records referred to in that subsection apply;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in subsection (4) for a period of at least 12 months after the date the gas metering installation or electricity metering installation, as the case may be, ceased to be used; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in subsection (6) for a period of at least 12 months after the date the gas distribution system ceased to be used.

Heading.Label: PART III
Heading.TitleText: Specifications, Permission, Approval, Revocation and Withdrawal

Subsection.Text: The director shall establish and make available on request the specifications relating to design, composition, construction and performance to which any meter or any class, type or design of meter shall conform before permission or approval with regard to that meter or such class, type or design of meter may be given pursuant to section 9 of the Act.
The director shall establish and make available on request the specifications relating to the installation and use of any meter or any class, type or design of meter.

Section.Text: An application for a permission or an approval referred to in section 9 of the Act shall be made in writing to the director and shall contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and principal place of business of the applicant;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: information sufficient to describe clearly the design, composition, construction and performance of the meter or the class, type or design of meter to which the application relates;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: data that indicate whether the meter or the class, type or design of meter to which the application relates meets all applicable requirements of the Act, these Regulations and the specifications established pursuant to section 12;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: where the manner of installation or use affects the performance of the meter or meters of the class, type or design to which the application relates, the manner in which the meter or each meter of the class, type or design is to be installed and used;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of any promotional material, instructions and other information distributed or intended for distribution to purchasers or prospective purchasers of the meter or the class, type or design of meter to which the application relates; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: such additional information in respect of the meter or the class, type or design of meter that is necessary for the purposes of the application.

Section.Text: An applicant shall make available to the director the meter or one or more meters representative of the class, type or design of meter to which the application referred to in section 13 relates, and shall also make available such equipment, material and services as are required to inspect and test the meter or meters.
Where the director grants an approval under subsection 9(3) or (4) of the Act, the director shall specify in writing in the approval any conditions to which the approval is subject.

Subsection.Text: A notice, referred to in paragraph 11(4)(a) of the Act, of a proposal to revoke a permission or an approval shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be sent by registered mail to the latest known principal place of business of the person to whom the permission or approval was granted; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contain the following information, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the terms and conditions of the permission or the conditions of the approval, as the case may be,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the meter or class, type or design of meter to which the notice relates,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date the permission or approval, as the case may be, was granted and the permission or approval number, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the term or condition of the permission or the condition of the approval, as the case may be, not complied with.

Subsection.Text: A notice, referred to in subsection 11(1) of the Act, of revocation of a permission and a notice, referred to in subsection 11(2) of the Act, of revocation of an approval shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be sent in the manner set out in paragraph (1)(a);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contain the information referred to in paragraph (1)(b);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a notice of revocation of a permission, contain a statement to the effect that, pursuant to subsection 11(3) of the Act, any meter that is in service pursuant to the permission being revoked shall be taken out of service; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a notice of revocation of an approval, contain a statement setting out any action to be taken pursuant to subsection 11(3) of the Act in respect of any meter that is in service pursuant to the approval being revoked.

Heading.TitleText: Notice to Withdraw Meters from Service

Section.Text: A notice referred to in subsection 22(1) of the Act shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: state the grounds on which the withdrawal is believed to be necessary,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be dated,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by the director, and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: be sent by registered mail to the latest known principal place of business of the owner of the meter

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: and a copy of the notice shall be published forthwith in the Canada Gazette.

Section.Text: The director shall establish and make available on request the specifications for the manner and circumstances in which meters of any class, type or design are to be tested, verified, sealed, reverified or resealed, and for the manner and circumstances in which any such meters are to be stamped, restamped, labelled, relabelled, tagged, retagged or otherwise marked.
The director is authorized to establish plans for the verification and reverification of meters of any class, type or design, or in any circumstances, by statistical means on the basis of sampling.

A notice referred to in subsection 12(2) of the Act shall be sent, by registered mail, to such persons as are considered likely to be directly affected by the reverification referred to in the notice at least 180 days prior to the earliest date on which any meter to which the notice applies will be required to be reverified and a copy of the notice shall be published forthwith in the Canada Gazette.

Subsection.Text: A certificate issued pursuant to section 14 of the Act in respect of a meter shall be numbered for identification and shall contain the following particulars:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the address or location at which the meter was verified or reverified;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the verification or reverification;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the identification numbers of the meter;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the manufacturer of the meter;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the class, type or design of the meter;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the identification numbers of all measuring apparatus used in verifying or reverifying the meter;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the owner of the meter;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the errors, if any, of the meter at all points tested;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the name and the signature of the person issuing the certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: whether the person signing the certificate is an inspector, an accredited meter verifier or a person, referred to in paragraph 10(a) of the Act, acting on behalf of an accredited meter verifier and, in the case of a person acting on behalf of an accredited meter verifier, the name of the accredited meter verifier on whose behalf that person is acting; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a gas meter, whether it is converting or non-converting for temperature or pressure, or both.

Subsection.Text: Where the verification or reverification of a meter has been done by statistical means on the basis of sampling, the certificate issued pursuant to section 14 of the Act shall include, in addition to the information required by subsection (1), an identification or listing of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the parent group or lot; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the meters tested.

Section.Text: An application for accreditation pursuant to section 10 of the Act shall be made in writing and shall state

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the applicant;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: whether the accreditation sought is with respect to electricity meters or gas meters;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the class, type or design of meters to which the accreditation would apply; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: that the applicant agrees, should accreditation be granted, to provide information relating to the execution of his functions as an accredited meter verifier.

Section.Text: An application referred to in section 22 shall be accompanied by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the applicant’s meter record system;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the most recent calibration certificate or accuracy check for each measuring apparatus to be used in the verification or reverification of meters;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a sample or scale drawing of any seal to be used;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the applicant’s meter testing infrastructure and procedures and quality assurance infrastructure and procedures;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an application regarding gas meters, a floor plan, with north indicated thereon, showing the location of provers, heaters, air conditioning ducts, windows, doors and any other feature likely to have an effect on temperature stability or air movement; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: such additional information in respect of the meter or its installation as is necessary for the purposes of the application.

Section.Text: An applicant for accreditation pursuant to section 10 of the Act shall demonstrate through an accreditation audit

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that the applicant has implemented and is maintaining acceptable procedures for

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: meter performance control,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: quality assurance,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: meter records,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: ensuring the security of seals and sealing tools, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: ensuring that only meters that have been properly verified or reverified are sealed; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that the facilities and test equipment of the applicant are such that all tests required by or pursuant to the Act can be carried out in accordance with the Act and these Regulations.

Section.Text: The director shall, in granting an accreditation, specify in writing in the certificate of accreditation any conditions to which the grant of accreditation is subject.

A certificate of accreditation referred to in paragraph 10(b) of the Act shall be dated and signed by the director and shall contain, in addition to any conditions specified in accordance with section 25,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the accredited meter verifier;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: whether the accreditation is with respect to electricity meters or gas meters;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the class, type and design of meters to which the accreditation applies; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement to the effect that, pursuant to subsection 11(2) of the Act, the accreditation may be revoked by the Minister for failure to comply with any condition to which the grant of accreditation was subject.

Subsection.Text: A notice, referred to in paragraph 11(4)(a) of the Act, of a proposal to revoke an accreditation shall be sent by registered mail to the latest known address of the accredited meter verifier to whom the accreditation was granted and a copy of the notice shall be published forthwith in the Canada Gazette.
A notice given pursuant to subsection (1) shall be dated and signed by the director and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in paragraphs 26(a) to (c);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the grant of accreditation; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the reason, or reasons, for proposing revocation.

Subsection.Text: A notice, referred to in subsection 11(2) of the Act, of revocation shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: contain the information referred to in subsection (2);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be dated and signed by the Minister; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: be sent and a copy of the notice published in the manner specified in subsection (1).

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of section 17 of the Act, an accredited meter verifier’s records shall contain the following information and documentation for each meter verified or reverified in the course of the accredited meter verifier’s business:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the certificate issued pursuant to section 14 of the Act and referred to in subsection 21(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where the verification or reverification was done

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: by statistical means on the basis of sampling, the information referred to in subsection 21(2), or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: by the owner of the meter, a statement by the owner confirming that the verification or reverification was completed in the manner established pursuant to section 18.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of section 17 of the Act, an accredited meter verifier’s records shall contain the following information and documentation for each measuring apparatus used in the course of the accredited meter verifier’s business, whether or not it is owned by the accredited meter verifier:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the certificate referred to in subsection 8(2); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: details of any associated test equipment and its calibration and maintenance.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of section 17 of the Act, an accredited meter verifier’s records shall contain information respecting the results of any tests carried out in the course of the accredited meter verifier’s business.
An accredited meter verifier shall retain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the records referred to in subsections (1) and (2) for a period of not less than six years after the date of the issue of the certificates referred to in those subsections; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the records referred to in subsection (3) for a period of not less than six years after the date the results first became available to the accredited meter verifier.

Subsection.Text: Where a request is made pursuant to subsection 23(1) of the Act by a contractor or purchaser who is dissatisfied with the condition or registration of a meter, an inspector shall investigate the matter by means of one or more of the following procedures:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: make inquiries of the contractor or purchaser who made the request and of any person who could reasonably be expected to have knowledge relevant to the matter;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: examine any records referred to in section 16 or 17 of the Act that are relevant to the matter; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: test the meter that is the subject of the request, after reasonable notice to the contractor and the purchaser involved in the matter that the meter will be tested at a time and place specified in the notice and that the contractor and the purchaser may appear or be represented at the test.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection 23(3) of the Act, the time in which a person may give notice to the inspector is 30 days after the date the certificate of findings referred to in that subsection was provided to that person.
A notice referred to in subsection 23(3) of the Act shall state in writing the reasons for dissatisfaction with the inspector’s findings.

Where a matter has been referred to the director pursuant to subsection 23(3) of the Act, the director shall notify in writing each person directly concerned with the matter that is the subject of the notice, including the owner of any meter tested by an inspector in connection with the matter, stating

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that the inspector has referred the matter to the director for reconsideration;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the reason or reasons for dissatisfaction indicated in the notice referred to in that subsection; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: that any written statement relating to the matter and received by the director within 30 days after the date of the notice will be considered.

Subsection.Text: The reconsideration referred to in subsection 23(3) of the Act shall take into account the certificate of findings referred to in subsection 23(2) of the Act, the reason or reasons stated pursuant to subsection 29(3) and any written statement received pursuant to paragraph (1)(c).

The director shall inform, in writing, each person notified pursuant to subsection (1) of the director’s decision on the matter referred to the director for reconsideration pursuant to subsection 23(3) of the Act.
For the purposes of subsections 24(1) and (2) of the Act, an error that is greater than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 3% of the amount of electricity or gas supplied through the meter, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where the amount of electricity supplied and the time-related demand for electricity supplied are the joint basis of a charge for electricity sold to a purchaser, with respect to a time-related demand, two and one-half per cent of the maximum point of the electricity meter’s demand scale

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection 24(3) of the Act, no error is permitted.

Section.Text: The functions of an inspector shall be the carrying out of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any inspection and testing of meters and any inspection of their installation required for the purposes of the Act and these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any inspection and testing required to enable the determination of a period for the purposes of paragraph 12(1)(c) of the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any accreditation audit referred to in section 24 or any audit required pursuant to a condition referred to in section 25;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any investigation required to assist in the determination of whether there is or has been an offence under section 30 of the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any investigations, tests, inquiries and examinations in relation to sections 9, 11 and 23 of the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: such other functions as are reasonably ancillary to the functions listed in paragraphs (a) to (e).

Section.Text: An inspector shall not, in the execution of his functions, use any measuring apparatus other than a measuring apparatus permitted by section 5 of the Act.

No person shall supply to a purchaser for any purpose other than processing or delivery for processing, natural gas that contains more than 0.030 per cent of water vapour, calculated by volume at standard pressure and standard temperature.

Section.Text: Where gas is sold by energy units, the number of energy units shall be the product obtained by multiplying

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the calorific power of a unit of mass of the gas by the number of the said units of mass of the gas; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the calorific power of a unit of volume of the gas at a certain temperature and certain pressure by the number of the said units of volume of the gas at the same certain temperature and same certain pressure.

Paragraph.Label: (c)

The director shall set out specifications, subject to sections 42 and 43, for determination of the calorific power of gas.

Subsection.Text: In this section, service in respect of a meter or metering installation, means to perform one or more of the following, namely, an inspection, a test, a verification or a reverification of a meter or metering installation.

Where an inspector services an electricity meter or an electricity metering installation set out in column I of an item of Part I of Schedule 1, the owner of the meter or metering installation shall pay

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a metering installation or where the meter is located at the operational location, the fee set out in column II of that item; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where the meter is not located at the operational location, the fee set out in column III of that item.

Subsection.Text: A person who requests an inspection or service described in column I of an item in Part II of Schedule 1 shall pay for that inspection or service the fee set out in column II of that item.
Where an inspector services a gas meter or gas metering installation set out in column I of an item of Part IV of Schedule 1, the owner of the meter or metering installation shall pay

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a metering installation or where the meter is located at the operational location, the fee set out in column II of that item; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where the meter is not located at the operational location, the fee set out in column III of that item.

Subsection.Text: A person who requests an inspection or service described in column I of an item in Part V of Schedule 1 shall pay for that inspection or service the fee set out in column II of that item.

The owner of an electricity meter or metering installation or a gas meter or metering installation who requests an inspection or service of the meter or installation shall pay, as remuneration for the time and expenses set out in column I of an item in Part VI of Schedule 1 incurred by the inspector in providing the requested inspection or service, the charges set out or referred to in column II of that item.

A person who requests an audit described in column I of an item in Part VII of Schedule 1 shall pay the fee set out in column II of that item, in the case of item 1, on performance of the requested audit by an inspector and, in the case of item 2, on a per annum basis.

The owner of an electricity measuring apparatus described in column I of an item in Part VIII of Schedule 1 shall pay the amount set out in column II of that item for the determination of the accuracy of the apparatus by the inspector by means of testing at points throughout the measuring range of the apparatus.

The owner of a gas measuring apparatus described in column I of an item in Part IX of Schedule 1 shall pay the amount set out in column II of that item for the determination of the accuracy of the apparatus by the inspector by means of testing at points throughout the measuring range of the apparatus.

Notwithstanding subsections (1) to (3) and (5) to (7), where an application is made in accordance with section 13 for an approval, referred to in subsection 9(4) of the Act, of a meter or a class, type or design of meter, the only charge payable for determining whether the meter or the class, type or design of meter conforms with the specifications referred to in section 12 is $25 for each half hour or part thereof so required.

Notwithstanding subsections (1.1) and (5), where a quality monitoring meter verification program has been implemented at an organization’s service facilities and the organization has complied with the criteria set out in the quality monitoring meter verification program manual, the owner shall pay

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for each meter inspected or for each meter verified or reverified under inspection level 1 as set out in the quality monitoring meter verification program manual, the fee set out for that type of meter in column III of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: Part I of Schedule 1, for electricity meters, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: Part IV of Schedule 1, for gas meters;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for each meter verified or reverified under inspection level 2 as set out in the quality monitoring meter verification program manual, two thirds of the fee set out for that type of meter in column III of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: Part I of Schedule 1, for electricity meters, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: Part IV of Schedule 1, for gas meters; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for each meter verified or reverified under inspection level 3 as set out in the quality monitoring meter verification program manual, one third of the fee set out for that type of meter in column III of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: Part I of Schedule 1, for electricity meters, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: Part IV of Schedule 1, for gas meters.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding subsections (1), (3) and (5), no fee or charge is payable with respect to any investigation by an inspector pursuant to subsection 29(1).

Section.Text: The contravention of a provision of the Act or these Regulations set out in column 1 of Part 1 or 2, respectively, of Schedule 2 may be proceeded with as a violation in accordance with sections 29.11 to 29.29 of the Act.
The violation of each provision set out in column 1 of Part 1 or 2 of Schedule 2 is classified as a minor, serious or very serious violation in accordance with the classification set out in column 2.

Subsection.Text: The amount of the penalty in respect of each violation is, subject to subsection (2),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: $250, for a minor violation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: $500, for a serious violation; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: $1,000, for a very serious violation.

Subsection.Text: The amount of the penalty is to be adjusted in accordance with the calculation set out in column 2 of Schedule 3 that corresponds to the history set out in column 1 of the person who has committed the violation.
For the purposes of determining a person’s history, the points set out in column 3 of Part 1 or 2 of Schedule 2 are assigned for each violation of a provision set out in column 1.

Section.Text: The notice of violation is to set out that an amount equal to 50% of the penalty may be paid as complete satisfaction of the penalty if it is paid within the period referred to in subsection 53(1) and in the manner set out in the notice of violation in accordance with subsection 53(6).

If the Minister enters into a compliance agreement under subsection 29.14(1) of the Act, the conditions of which include the making of expenditures by a person, the amount of the penalty set out in the notice of violation is to be reduced by an amount equal to one half of the expenditures made in fulfilment of the agreement, with a maximum reduction to nil.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph 29.12(2)(e) of the Act, payment is to be made within 15 days after the day on which the person is provided with the notice of violation.

For the purposes of subsection 29.13(1) of the Act, payment of the penalty set out in the notice of violation is to be made within 30 days after the day on which the person is provided with the notice.
For the purposes of paragraph 29.14(4)(a) of the Act, payment is to be made within 15 days after the day on which the person is provided with the notice of default.
For the purposes of subsection 29.15(1) of the Act, payment is to be made within 15 days after the day on which the person is provided with the Minister’s notice.

For the purposes of subsection 29.16(3) of the Act, payment is to be made within 15 days after the day on which the person is provided with notice of the Minister’s decision under subsection 29.16(1) or (2) of the Act.
A payment referred to in any of subsections (1) to (5) is to be made in one of the following manners, as set out in the applicable notice:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: by means of a certified cheque or money order made payable to the Receiver General for Canada and submitted to a Measurement Canada office

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: by registered mail, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: by courier; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: by electronic means.

Heading.TitleText: Requests Under Subsection 29.13(2) of the Act

Subsection.Text: A request under paragraph 29.13(2)(a) or (b) of the Act shall be made, as set out in the notice, by submitting the following information in writing to a Measurement Canada office in person, by registered mail or courier or by electronic means within 30 days after the day on which the person is provided with the notice of violation:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the notice of violation number, as set out in the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person’s name, mailing address, email address, telephone number, facsimile number and contact person, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an indication of whether the person prefers to communicate in English or French;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a request under paragraph 29.13(2)(a) of the Act, a proposal detailing the corrective action that will be taken to ensure the person’s compliance with the provision to which the violation relates; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a request made under 29.13(2)(b) of the Act, the person’s reasons for requesting the review.

Subsection.Text: The date of the request is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which it is submitted, if it is submitted in person; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which it is sent, if it is sent by registered mail, courier or electronic means.
